DOC.brief_title: Behavioral Intervention HIV HCV-Uninfected Injection Drug Users
DOC.detailed_description: CIDUS III/DUIT five-city ( Baltimore , Chicago , Los Angeles , New York , Seattle ) randomize control trial develop evaluate efficacy six-session behavioral intervention HIV HCV uninfected injection drug user age 15 30 year . The primary goal intervention : 1. decrease share use syringe injection paraphernalia , 2. decrease sexual risk behavior associate HIV HCV infection , 3. decrease incidence hepatitis C virus ( HCV ) infection . The intervention arm consist six small-group train skills-building session teach reinforce peer education activity around decrease sex injection risk behavior HIV HCV infection . In fifth session , participant practice peer education around sex injection risk behavior within community . The control arm consist six video discussion session control attention . Prior study enrollment , participant arm receive HIV HCV test client-centered pre- post-test counseling also control demand risk reduction information . Behavioral assessment ( audio computer assist self interviewing ) blood draw ( serologic test ) occur baseline , 3 6 month follow-up . 3285 participant complete baseline visit , 1564 test HIV HCV seronegative return test result make eligible enroll intervention trial . Of eligible participant , 854 randomize trial . 606 591 return 3 6 month follow-up assessment , respectively , 712 participant complete least one follow-up visit .
